head.supplied: Botanic Gardens ¶ 12 March 1867 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ On the first of December last I had the honor of submitting to you a Requisition (No 46) for additional Waterpipes &c needed for further ramification of the ...

div.p: Q67/2646, unit 252, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; text-align: end;

div.p: MS written by Ernst Heyne?. Botanic Gardens

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; text-align: end;

div.p:
On the first of December last I had the honor of submitting to you a Requisition (No 46) for additional Waterpipes &c needed for further ramification of the Yan Yean pipes through the Botanic Gardens, which you were good enough to approve of at the time, the expenses so incurred (£150.0.0) to be charged to the Vote for Water Supply,
Marginal note: (£150.0.0). available for this Department for the past year. The work referred to was finished under the superintendence of the Department for the Melbourne Sewers & Watersupply,
sic.
who submitted an account for the amount stated in December last. Not having received however the usual Authority (the number of which must be quoted on the Voucher transmitted to the Treasury) I have not been able to pass this Account for payment and beg therefore most respectfully that you will be pleased to direct such Authority to be transmitted to me.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be
